Barriers by Type: View the barriers by type (dam, crossing, natural barrier)
Rivers: Zoom in to the scale of a city or town to view the rivers in the region.
Flood Risk: View culverts symbolized by their risk of overtopping the road in a flood.

coastal: The coastal anadromous fish scenario is focused on identifying priority passage projects for sea-run brook trout, smelt, and other species move between smaller coastal streams and the ocean. Only barriers that are on coastal streams (those that drain less than 100 sq miles and whose mouth is in tidal waters) are prioritized in this scenario. Road-stream crossings that are themselves on tidal waters are also excluded from this prioritization because of uncertainties and variabilities surrounding passage at tidal crossings.
alewife: The alewife scenario prioritizes barriers whose removal could most benefit alewife.  Only those barriers that have alewife spawning ponds upstream of them are prioritized.
inlandBKT: The inland brook trout scenario prioritizes inland barriers for their potential to benefit Eastern brook trout if removed/improved passage. Coastal barriers are excluded from this analysis (see the coastal anadromous scenario for a prioritization of barriers for sea-run brook trout).   Some of the metrics that are used in this scenario are not available for barriers on larger rivers.  Therefore, these barriers (generally dams) are also excluded from this scenario.
salmon: The salmon scenario prioritizes barriers that could benefit salmon if removed/improved passage.  All barriers are included in this scenario.
shadBBH: The shad/blueback herring scenario prioritizes barriers that could benefit American shad and blueback herring if removed/improved passage.  All barriers are included in this scenario.

welcomeHeader: Welcome to the Maine Aquatic Barrier Prioritization tool
welcomeText:
This tool is designed to support the river restoration community in identifying in-stream barriers for removal or improved fish passage. The prioritized results are designed to help identify high priority fish passage projects. It is based on the best available regional data and does not incorporate any data on social, feasibility, or economic factors. It is intended to provide screening-level support, and should not be considered a substitute for local-scale information.

This tool builds on the Penobscot Aquatic Barrier Prioritization tool, which was funded by the NOAA Office of Habitat Conservation through the NOAA Habitat Blueprint, Penobscot Habitat Focus Area.

This material is based upon work supported by the Natural Resources Conservation Service, U.S. Department of Agriculture, under number NR181218XXXXG001.

Any opinions, findings, conclusions, or recommendations expressed in this publication are those of the author(s) and do not necessarily reflect the views of the U.S. Department of Agriculture.

For more details on how to use the tool please see the tool user's guide

metricNames.batAbs: Absolute Gain (min of upstream & Downstream functional network)
metricNames.batLenUS: Total length of upstream river network (Ignoring barriers)
metricNames.batUSDnsty: Density of barriers on upstream network
metricNames.DSFishways: Count of downstream fish passage facilities
metricNames.NESZCL_Int: River Size Class (based on drainage area)
metricNames.usNatBar: One of upstream barriers is a natural barrier
metricNames.Aquifer: Aquifers  are found in upstream OR downstream functional network
metricNames.AquiferOrCoarseSed: Aquifer OR coarse sediments are found in upstreamOR downstream functional network
metricNames.CalcModCalc: Calcareous or moderately calcareous geology is found in upstream OR downstream functional network
metricNames.MilesBT_MHVH: Miles of medium, high, or very high priority brook trout habitat in upstream + downstream networks
metricNames.MilesBT_MHVH_USonly: Miles of medium, high, or very high priority brook trout habitat in upstream functional network
metricNames.BT_1_4_HVH: Presence of High priority or Very High brook trout habitat upstream OR downstream of barrier
metricNames.BT_1_4_MHVH: Presence of Medium, High, or Very High prioritybrook trout habitat upstream OR downstream of barrier
metricNames.BT_1_4_VH: Presence of >=1/4 mile Very High priority brook trout habitat upstream OR downstream of barrier
metricNames.EBTJV_Patch: Barrier is within EBTJV Wild Brook Trout Patches
metricNames.HeritagePondBarrier: Is the barrier between two networks with heritage fish ponds
metricNames.InvasiveBarrier: Invasive species are found in the network on one side of a barrier and not the other
metricNames.InvasiveBarrierConfirmed: Invasive species (confirmed occurances) are found in the network on one side of a barrier and not the other
metricNames.InvasiveBarrierConfNumSpp: # of Invasive species that are blocked (confirmed occurances)
metricNames.usCons100: % Conserved land in 100m buffer of upstream functional network
metricNames.dsCons100: % Conserved land in 100m buffer of upstream functional network
metricNames.DA_PercFor: Percent Forested Landcover in upstream drainage area
metricNames.buff100_US_Perc_Statewide_forestMerged: % forest cover in 100m buffer of upstream network
metricNames.buff100_DS_Perc_Statewide_forestMerged: % forest cover in 100m buffer of downstream network
metricNames.buff100_Tot_Perc_Statewide_forestMerged: % forest cover in 100m buffer of total network (upstream & downstream)
metricNames.buff100_US_Perc_nlcd_2016_developedMedHi: % medium/high intensity developed landcover in 100m buffer of upstream network
metricNames.buff100_DS_Perc_nlcd_2016_developedMedHi: % medium/high intensity developed landcover in 100m buffer of downstream network
metricNames.buff100_Tot_Perc_nlcd_2016_developedMedH: % medium/high intensity developed landcover in 100m buffer of total network (upstream & downstream)
metricNames.buff100_US_Perc_nlcd_2016_cultivatedCrop: % cultivated crops in 100m buffer of upstream network
metricNames.buff100_DS_Perc_nlcd_2016_cultivatedCrop: % cultivated crops in 100m buffer of downstream network
metricNames.buff100_Tot_Perc_nlcd_2016_cultivatedCro: % cultivated crops in 100m buffer of total network (upstream & downstream)
metricNames.buff100_US_Perc_nlcd_2016_pastureHay: % pasture/hay in 100m buffer of upstream network
metricNames.buff100_DS_Perc_nlcd_2016_pastureHay: % pasture/hay in 100m buffer of downstream network
metricNames.buff100_Tot_Perc_nlcd_2016_pastureHay: % pasture/hay in 100m buffer of total network (upstream & downstream)
metricNames.floodplain_US_Perc_Statewide_forestMerge: % forest cover in floodplain of upstream network
metricNames.floodplain_DS_Perc_Statewide_forestMerge: % forest cover in floodplain of downstream network
metricNames.floodplain_Tot_Perc_Statewide_forestMerg: % forest cover in floodplain of total network (upstream & downstream)
metricNames.floodplain_US_Perc_nlcd_2016_developedMe: % medium/high intensity developed landcover in floodplain of upstream network
metricNames.floodplain_DS_Perc_nlcd_2016_developedMe: % medium/high intensity developed landcover in floodplain of downstream network
metricNames.floodplain_Tot_Perc_nlcd_2016_developedM: % medium/high intensity developed landcover in floodplain of total network (upstream & downstream)
metricNames.floodplain_US_Perc_nlcd_2016_cultivatedC: % cultivated crops in floodplain of upstream network
metricNames.floodplain_DS_Perc_nlcd_2016_cultivatedC: % cultivated crops in floodplain of downstream network
metricNames.floodplain_Tot_Perc_nlcd_2016_cultivated: % cultivated crops in floodplain of total network (upstream & downstream)
metricNames.floodplain_US_Perc_nlcd_2016_pastureHay: % pasture/hay in floodplain of upstream network
metricNames.floodplain_DS_Perc_nlcd_2016_pastureHay: % pasture/hay in floodplain of downstream network
metricNames.floodplain_Tot_Perc_nlcd_2016_pastureHay: % pasture/hay in floodplain of total network (upstream & downstream)
metricNames.cumulativeSalmHabUnits: Cumulative upstream salmon habitat units, discounted by barrier pass
metricNames.cumulativeUSNet: Cumulative upstream network length, discounted by barrier pass
metricNames.onDMRSalmonPriority: DMR Priority Stream category that the barrier is on
metricNames.HUC10_CritSalmHab: Barrier is in a Salmon Critical Habitat HUC10
metricNames.HUC10_Habitat_Units: Summed modeled salmon habitat units in the HUC10 the barrier is within
metricNames.US_SalmHabUnits: # Salmon habitat units in US Functional network
metricNames.US_SalmParrProd: Sum of salmon parr productivity in US functional network
metricNames.dsPassabilityProduct: The product (multiplication) of downstream barrier passability scores
metricNames.MilesUS_HATcurrent: Miles of tidal habitat (current) upstream of barrier
metricNames.MilesUS_HATPlus1m: Miles of tidal habitat (HAT +1m) upstream of barrier
metricNames.MilesUS_HATPlus6ft: Miles of tidal habitat (HAT +6ft) upstream of barrier
metricNames.Tidal: Barrier is located on a tidal stream (HAT +1m)
metricNames.usAlewifeAcres: Upstream acres of alewife ponds (total, ignoring any barriers in the way)
metricNames.usSmeltSite: There are smelt sites upstream of the barrier

metricShortNames.BT_1_4_HVH: >=1/4 mile High/VH BT Hab in US or DS
metricShortNames.BT_1_4_MHVH: >=1/4 mile Med/High/VH BT Hab in US or DS
metricShortNames.BT_1_4_VH: >=1/4 mile VH BT Hab in US or DS
metricShortNames.buff100_US_Perc_nlcd_2016_developedMedHi: % med-high intensity dev in US 100m buff
metricShortNames.buff100_DS_Perc_nlcd_2016_developedMedHi: % med-high intensity dev in DS 100m buff
metricShortNames.buff100_Tot_Perc_nlcd_2016_developedMedH: % med-high intensity dev in total network 100m buff
metricShortNames.floodplain_Tot_Perc_nlcd_2016_developedM: % med-high intensity dev in total network floodplain
metricShortNames.US_SalmHabUnits: # salmon habitat units in US network
metricShortNames.MilesUS_HATcurrent: Miles tidal habitat US of barrier (current)
metricShortNames.MilesUS_HATPlus1m: Miles tidal habitat US of barrier (+1m)
metricShortNames.MilesUS_HATPlus6ft: Miles tidal habitat US of barrier (+6ft)
metricShortNames.SeaRunBT: Barrier on sea run BKT river
